biography.bio: Douglas Håge was born on March 6, 1898 in Gothenburg, Västra Götalands län, Sweden as Oskar Fredrik Douglas Håge. He was an actor, known for Fridolfs farliga ålder (1959), Lille Fridolf och jag (1956) and Lille Fridolf blir morfar (1957). He was married to Maja Håge. He died on November 18, 1959 in Gothenburg.
biography.name: Douglas Håge

biography.bio: When Hjördis Petterson was twelve years old, the local movie theatre in Visby needed somebody who could play the piano, so they gave her the opportunity. She also played the piano for the local amateur theatre, Visby Amatörsällskap, and eventually she got her first part. She became interested and got herself a tutor, the actor Emil Hillberg. When she was 18, she moved to Stockholm in 1926 to become an actor, and in 1927 she became a pupil at the Royal Theatre of Dramatic Art. This led to a professional career, first in bit parts but later in greater roles. Her first movie was Kanske en diktare (1933). She mainly worked in the theatre, only making small roles in front of the camera. Notable appearances are Lille Fridolf och jag (1956) and The People of Hemso (1955). She is the Swedish actress who has made the most number of movies. Her last acting performance was in 1985.
biography.name: Hjördis Petterson

biography.bio: Lars Ekborg was born on June 6, 1926 in Uppsala, Uppsala län, Sweden. He was an actor, known for Summer with Monika (1953), The Magician (1958) and Att angöra en brygga (1965). He was married to Lola Ekborg. He died on October 7, 1969 in Sweden.
biography.name: Lars Ekborg

biography.bio: Inga Gill was born on May 2, 1925 in Stockholm, Stockholms län, Sweden. She was an actress, known for The Seventh Seal (1957), Cries & Whispers (1972) and Miss Julie (1951). She was married to Karl-Arne Holmsten. She died on October 18, 2000 in Stockholm.
biography.name: Inga Gill

biography.bio: Jan Molander was born on April 2, 1920 in Stockholm, Stockholms län, Sweden. He was an actor and director, known for Woman in a Fur Coat (1958), Hemma klockan sju (1958) and Det var en annan historia (1959). He died on June 30, 2009 in Sweden.
biography.name: Jan Molander

biography.bio: Siv Ericks was born on July 31, 1918 in Nyköping, Södermanlands län, Sweden as Siv Gustava Eriksson. She was an actress, known for Fanny and Alexander (1982), Pippi Longstocking (1969) and Diary of a Rape (1971). She died on July 3, 2005 in Onsala, Västra Götalands län, Sweden.
biography.name: Siv Ericks

biography.bio: Once one of Sweden's hardest working actors, he has descibed himself as a workaholic during the 1940s. He has played all kinds of roles, both comedy as in Fram för lilla Märta eller På livets ödesvägar (1945) as well as the psychotic teacher Caligula in Alf Sjöberg's Torment (1944). And although he only did smaller roles in a lot of films, his characterizations never went unnoticed. He was also an actor on the stage, both in revues and dramas. He spent his last years in Rocquebrune at the French Riviera with his wife Aase.
biography.name: Stig Järrel

biography.bio: As a youth, Sigge Fürst wanted to be a police officer. By coincidence, he got into acting, and so began a long and successful career. He had many talents: he could play revue as well as drama, act as well as sing. He started off as a revue actor, and then moved on to play musicals, theatre, and become a popular radio host with the show "Frukostklubben". He also toured Sweden and did a lot of charity work. Today, more than a decade after his death, he remains one of the most respected and beloved artists Sweden has ever known.
biography.name: Sigge Fürst

biography.bio: Elof Ahrle was born on January 21, 1900 in Nyköping, Södermanlands län, Sweden as Gustaf Elof Carlson. He was an actor and director, known for Tre skojiga skojare (1942), I gult och blått (1942) and Song of Stockholm (1947). He was married to Birgit Rosengren and Naemi Briese. He died on June 3, 1965.
biography.name: Elof Ahrle

biography.bio: Nils Bertil Hallberg was a Swedish actor appearing in 105 feature films and television productions. He was active 1934-85. Besides being a frequent performer in the movies, he took part in Swedish theatre as well. Nils Hallberg was discovered at age 13 by director Sigurd Wallén, when he was selecting youngsters for the family movie "Anderssonskans Kalle" (1934). After the career as a child actor he was often casted as villain or the bad guy. From 1955 to 1965 he was highly regarded for a long series of comic roles.His greatest performance on film was in "Kärlekens bröd" (1953).
biography.name: Nils Hallberg

biography.bio: Erik Strandmark was born on September 14, 1919 in Torsaker, Sweden. He was an actor and director, known for The Seventh Seal (1957), Sawdust and Tinsel (1953) and The People of Hemso (1955). He died on January 5, 1963 in Trinidad, West Indies.
biography.name: Erik Strandmark

biography.bio: Sif Ruud was born in an well-off family, but when her stepfather had spent all of her mother's money, conditions for the family became more modest. A friend of her mother's was told about young Sif's interest in acting and gave her acting lessons. In 1934 she began her studies at the Royal Dramatic Theatre's acting school in Stockholm. One of her fellow students was Gunn Wållgren and one of the teachers was Hilda Borgström. After graduation, she worked in different theatres around Sweden. Her career at the movies has mainly been in smaller parts. Best known is perhaps her performance as aunt Olga who dominates the breakfast table and rules it as her empire in Ingmar Bergman's Wild Strawberries (1957). She was praised for her role as Madam Flod in "Hemsöborna" (1966) (mini).
biography.name: Sif Ruud

biography.birthName: Jeannette Wedday Marianne Ida Carolina Löfgren
biography.bio: Marianne Löfgren was born on February 24, 1910 in Stockholm, Sweden as Jeannette Wedday Marianne Ida Carolina Löfgren. She was an actress, known for Crisis (1946), June Night (1940) and Girl with Hyacinths (1950). She was married to Bergvall, Tycho. She died on September 4, 1957 in Solna, Stockholms län, Sweden.
biography.name: Marianne Löfgren

biography.bio: Carl-Axel Elfving was born on January 12, 1920 in Örnsköldsvik, Västernorrlands län, Sweden. He was an actor, known for Summer with Monika (1953), Den tappre soldaten Jönsson (1956) and 47:an Löken blåser på! (1972). He died on January 12, 1988 in Enskede, Stockholm, Stockholms län, Sweden.
biography.name: Carl-Axel Elfving

biography.bio: Astrid Bodin was born on July 10, 1903 in Österunda, Västmanlands län, Sweden as Astrid Linnéa Bodin. She was an actress, known for Summer with Monika (1953), Åsa-Nisse som polis (1960) and Åsa-Nisse jubilerar (1959). She was married to Eric Dahlström. She died on October 20, 1961 in Stockholm, Stockholms län, Sweden.
biography.name: Astrid Bodin

filmingLocations.location: Nordisk Tonefilm, Kungsholmen, Stockholm, Stockholms län, Sweden
